sentence.Network_en: I was determined not to succumb to the virus.
The Minister said his country would never succumb to pressure.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相说他的国家永远都不会屈服于压迫。

sentence.Network_en: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要经不住诱惑，只抽一支烟也不行。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... concubine n 情妇，妾 succumb v 屈服；死亡 accumbent a 卧着的.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... succinct 简洁的，简明的 succumb 屈从；死亡 sufficient 足够的.
考博英语词汇 ... suburban a. 郊外的，郊区的；兼有城市和乡 succumb v. 屈服，屈从；死 soporific a. 发汗的 n．发汗剂.
While others might succumb to failure , they tend to retreat and give in their efforts ., 其他人可能屈服于失败 , 他们更倾向于在他们的努力 , 把撤退.

list.abs: people who succumb easily to exploitation ., 容易受人利用的人.
They are watching their children succumb to malnutrition caused by poverty and economic deprivation ., 他们观看他们的孩子屈服对贫穷和经济剥夺造成的营养不良.
Ferguson now argues that the United States may be succumbing to financial overstretch ., 弗格森争辩说 , 美国可能会屈从于金融过度扩张的压力.
I ' ve succumbed to the cruel battle ,, 残酷的战役 , 我一路退却,

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'bring low, overwhelm'): from Old French succomber or Latin succumbere, from sub- 'under' + a verb related to cubare 'to lie'

entry.tran: 屈从于，屈服于，抵挡不住(诱惑或压力)
entry.def: If you succumb to temptation or pressure, you do something that you want to do, or that other people want you to do, although you feel it might be wrong.

example.ex: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette...
example.tran: 不要经不住诱惑，只抽一支烟也不行。

example.ex: The Minister said his country would never succumb to pressure.
example.tran: 首相说他的国家永远都不会屈服于压迫。

entry.def: If you succumb to an illness, you become affected by it or die from it.

example.ex: A few years later, Katya succumbed to cancer in London...
example.tran: 几年后，卡佳因患癌症在伦敦病逝。

example.ex: I was determined not to succumb to the virus.

auth_sentence.content: We are not going to succumb to any pressure.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are not going to succumb to any pressure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are not going to succumb to any pressure.

auth_sentence.content: It's very easy to succumb to temptation.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's very easy to succumb to temptation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's very easy to succumb to temptation.

auth_sentence.content: Either succumb to the pressure or face it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Either succumb to the pressure or face it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Either succumb to the pressure or face it.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =lie down,表示"躺"; 2. =barrier,表示躺的"东西,障碍"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ac加强+cumb躺+ent……的→adj.横卧的,斜靠的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 职责所在的,负有……义务的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in内+cumb躺+ent……的→在某[职位]躺着→任某种职位
encumber[v.妨害,阻碍]+ance表名词→encumbrance妨碍物
in内+cumb躺+ency表名词→在某[职位]躺着→职责
suc下面+cumb躺→躺下去→屈从;死亡

stems_affixes.type_exp: 等在同辅音词根前表示"在下面;随后"

stems_affixes.word_buile: suc在下面;随后+cinct捆→在下面先捆好→简洁的
suc在下面;随后+ceed走→从下走到上面→成功
suc在下面;随后+cumb躺→躺下去→屈从;死亡

sentences.en: He succumbed to the temptations of the big city.
sentences.cn: 他受不住大城市的诱惑。

sentences.en: Many women had succumbed to his charms.
sentences.cn: 许多女人屈从于他的魅力。

sentences.en: She succumbed to weariness and went to bed.
sentences.cn: 她疲惫不堪，上床睡觉了。

sentences.en: After an artillery bombardment lasting several days the town finally succumbed.
sentences.cn: 在持续炮轰数日后,该城终于屈服了。

sentences.en: Malnourished children are more likely to succumb to infections.
sentences.cn: 营养不良的儿童更有可能死于感染。

sentences.en: The island’s inhabitants had no immunity to the diseases carried by the explorers and quickly succumbed.
sentences.cn: 岛上居民对探险者携带的病毒没有免疫力，很快就死去了。
